Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a means to control and suppress alternative media and democratic opposition.
There is a distrust of those who define what constitutes misinformation, particularly non-elected bureaucrats and politicians.
The submission argues that mainstream media and government narratives have been biased and misleading, particularly during the pandemic.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to democratic freedom and freedom of speech.
The definitions of harm in the legislation are criticized for being based on potential outcomes rather than actual harm.
Main Themes: Freedom of speech and democratic debate
Criticism of pandemic management and narratives
Concerns about censorship and control of information
Notable Quotes: The elephant in the room here being who wears the jackboots and gets to define what information is.
This legislation is reasonably likely to cause harm to our democratic freedom.
This proposed legislation is a trojan horse attack on democratic debate and freedom of speech in Australia.
